page.title: 06LITTLE LONDON IN ROCHDALE
page.content: {'Little London'}is part of the area of Balderstone. It includes 22 cottages on Oldham Road, Holly Street, Craiglands and Culvert Street. It was built in 1863 by Joshua Radcliffe for people who used to work in his {Balderstone Mill}spinning cotton. Many of these people came from London and so the area became known as 'Little London'. The cottages were due for demolition ten years ago, but were saved by changes in council policy and made to look like new in 1982. Councillor Derek Walker and Mr. Geoff Sanderson re-opened them on { {April 20th.,}1982.
